Hey guys, I've found our problem with not being able to start the quest. Follow these simple steps ^.^

1. Unpack the patch and copy it to Skyrim folder.
2. Unpack Dawnguard and copy the stuff to your Data folder which is in your Skyrim folder.
3. Go to Documents/My Games/Skyrim folder and find SkyrimPrefs.ini
4. Add this line bEnableFileSelection=1 under “[LAUNCHER]” in the file.
5. Start the game over launcher, click on DATA FILES and tick Dawnguard on.
6. Enjoy the DLC.

Works like a charm so far. Also to answer the question that gets asked 50 times every time a new update is release... YES this includes previous updates >_> There's no virus either, this torrent works as advertised.

if you cant see the data files in the launcher go to your save games and find skyrim prefrences . ini . open in notepad 

Look for the line:
[Launcher]
bShowAllResolutions=0
uLastAspectRatio=2

And add it like this:
[Launcher]
bShowAllResolutions=0
uLastAspectRatio=2
bEnableFileSelection=1

Good luck. :psyduck:

Example : I loaded my save in Whiterun, a guard gives me the Dawnguard quest, but when i try to exit Whiterun or fast-travel to a "Skyrim" Open-world location the game switches to the loading screen but then suddenly stops loading and crasches or just keeps hanging and doing nothing !!!!!!! Example 2 : when i load a save i which i am in the Open-world it automaticly spawns me in the inn in riverwood and when i try to "enter Skyrim" from there the game crasches aswell Dafuq?!!!??!?!? 
Strange thing is, when i untick the Dawnstar DLC everything work just fine! Could somebody help me with this strange problem? Thx

The way patches work: 

Patch 3 contains whatever updated. 

Patch 6 contains ALL of Patch 3, PLUS whatever it does.

So, you can skip until the last patch if you want, everything should work appropriately. I got 3, then 5, then 9 and everything is fine. 

Haven't updated with the Dawnguard patch or the DLC yet, though.
